metadata.subject: Property Rendering - To be Constructed | GSA Joint Venture Equity Financing & Pre-Sale Acquisition Opportunity

relationships.description: Stan Johnson Company is marketing the property development opportunity on behalf of Hoover Properties
USCIS is a component agency of DHS
GSA is the leasing agency for US government facilities

transactions: US purchase of Virgin Islands for $25 million in gold

analysis.purpose: To solicit investment in a pre-sale/JV opportunity for a GSA facility construction project
analysis.significance: Offers insight into government real estate development partnerships and investment structures for federal facilities

notable_quotes: The Property is mission critical to CIS as it will house a consolidation of multiple CIS facilities including current facilities in St. Croix and Charlotte Amalie
Exceptional Credit Tenancy â€“ Boasting an 'AA+' credit rating by S&P and an 'Aaa' credit rating by Moody's, the lease is guaranteed by the United States of America
In 1917, St. Thomas was purchased (along with Saint John and Saint Croix) by the United States for $25 million in gold

blackmail_indicators.description: No indicators of blackmail or coercion found - document is a standard real estate investment offering

illegal_activity.description: No illegal activity discussed - document is a legitimate real estate investment offering memorandum

public_knowledge.context: Standard commercial real estate offering documents are typically not newsworthy unless involving prominent figures or controversial projects

analysis.summary: This is an offering memorandum for a pre-sale joint venture opportunity to finance and acquire a new GSA-leased Citizenship and Immigration Services facility in St. Thomas, US Virgin Islands, featuring a 10-year lease with the US government and approximately $6.66 million in development costs.
